title: Park Hall Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: charles c / Park Hall Country Park
images.caption: Park Hall Country Park. A former quarry,now a site of scientific interest and nature reserve.

images.title: charles c / View from car park
images.caption: View from car park

images.title: charles c / Country Park
images.caption: Showing layers of Triassic sandstone laid down 243 million years ago when the climate was a desert.

images.title: Phil Eptlett / Picnic at Park Hall
images.caption: Park Hall Country Park is Stoke on Trent's only National Nature Reserve comprising woodland, heathland & ponds. Gravel was extracted between 1939 & 1970 but nature has now taken over and the area is a haven for natural wildlife & fanua.

description: Enjoy a cycle or walk in this large country park in Stoke-on-Trent. The park is popular with dog walkers with its nice woodland areas and two ponds. From the high points in the park there are good views over the city. You can extend your exercise by visiting the nearby Hanley Forest Park where there are more cycling and walking paths to try. There's also the Stoke on Trent Canal Walk along the towpath of the Trent and Mersey Canal to try.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's lots of picnic tables dotted around the site where you can enjoy some rest and refreshment after your exercise.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and parkland trails are great for dog walking with many off lead areas. You will probably bump into other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: On the western side of the city there's another fine country park in the shape of Apedale Country Park in Newcastle Under Lyme. The waterside path around Westport Lake is another good local option for an easy stroll.

display_address: Hulme Road, Werrington, Hulme, Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, England, ST2 0GA, United Kingdom
